column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to the [[Wikipedia:Royal Society of Literature|Royal Society of Literature]]'''.<ref name=CG>{{CG|C}}

column1: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien declines to write an obituary of [[C.S. Lewis]] for the Society's journal ''Report''
column2: but suggests that [[Owen Barfield]] do so instead. Tolkien writes: "I feel his loss so deeply that I have since his death refused to write or speak about him".<ref name=CG/>

column1: *'''Publication:''' A quote from the letter appeared in the article "Literary Greats Exposed as Gossips and Snipes" by Martin Bentham
